name: 02-Data Description
content:
Data Description

The dataset contains detailed information on the chemical composition and mechanical properties of alloys. It is designed to support predictive modeling of tensile strength and related material performance metrics.

Key Features:

1.Chemical Composition Variables (Input Features):

  • Al: Amount of Aluminum in the alloy.
  • Cu: Amount of Copper in the alloy.
  • Si: Amount of Silicon in the alloy.
  • Fe: Amount of Iron in the alloy.
  • Mn: Amount of Manganese in the alloy.
  • Zn: Amount of Zinc in the alloy.
  • Ti: Amount of Titanium in the alloy.
  • Mg: Amount of Magnesium in the alloy.
  • Residuals: Trace/remaining elements in the alloy.

2.Mechanical Properties (Target and Supporting Variables):

  • UTS (Ultimate Tensile Strength): Maximum stress the alloy can withstand before breaking. (Primary prediction target)
  • TensileStrengthYieldProof: Yield strength, i.e., the maximum stress the alloy can sustain before permanent deformation.
  • BrinellHardness: Hardness measure of the alloy based on indentation testing.
  • FatigueStrength: Maximum cyclic stress the material can endure without failure.
